meanings.sent1: The magician created an idolum of a dragon out of smoke and mirrors.
meanings.sent2: The painting was just an idolum of the beautiful landscape the artist had seen.
meanings.sent3: The idolum of a giant banana made everyone laugh at the fruit-themed party.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an idolum, hiding the pain she felt inside.
meanings.sent5: The idolum of the monster under the bed haunted the child's dreams.

meanings.definition: An object of worship, especially a false god
meanings.sent1: In ancient times, people would bow down to the idolum made of gold.
meanings.sent2: The villagers built an idolum to pray to during the harvest season.
meanings.sent3: The idolum in the temple seemed to frown when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: Money can become an idolum, worshipped above all else by some.
meanings.sent5: The idolum of fame led the actor down a path of loneliness and despair.
